text: "Chabora" refers to a traditional Pakistani household located in a rural area. This place typically includes fields, gardens, and domestic animals. The people in Chabora mostly rely on agriculture and lead a simple life. == History == Historically, the term "Chabora" also refers to artisans who work with wood, crafting and decorating it. These artisans are often involved in agriculture and woodworking. Additionally, the term is used in the context of adornment for women, especially when a girl reaches adulthood, and her new appearance is referred to as "Chhab Takhti." == References == Category:Tribes Category:Ethnic groups in Pakistan Category:Tribes of Pakistan Category:Punjabi people
title: Chabora
